title: Yasuo's Name
body: Just wanted to say this "YASUO meaning "man of peace" (康夫)" except in his lore he "is a man of resolve, an agile swordsman who wields the wind itself to cut down his foes." so why exactly is he cutting down foes for...or rather who are his foes? o-o not sure about you but makes me think.

replies.body:
His enemies are the Ionian led assassins and warrior that try to deal with him. 
He's killing people because self-defense. 
"People are always running into my blade."
He doesn't start the fights until
he finds the killer of his master of course. {{champion:92}} 
He's a man of peace because he's looking to settle down. 

{{champion:157}}

Dude,it's too long to explain it here.So I will give you a link to the Yasuo lore and his relationship with other champs.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=78XNwwK8Bzw
"there must be a reason that he is called the unforgiven"... no shit
I like how he goes in depth and brings up conclusions lol
it's almost like they were trying to be ironic.

Yasuo's setting is based on japanese mythology and culture, but it is not japan.

you're reading into this too literally.
